alert.note: Alert for Clay (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 11 at 3:43PM CDT until April 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUEL CONDITIONS FOR WESTERN NORTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuel conditions, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * TIMING...Wednesday afternoon and early evening. * WINDS...Northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low at 10 to 15 mph percent. * TEMPERATURES...Highs in the upper 70s. * FUELS...Dormant and extremely dry fuels will allow extreme fire behavior to develop.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
